issue.title: [Bug]: Playwright Test for VSCode not always running global setup

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
### Version 1.46.0 ### Steps to reproduce 1. Install VS Code and add the [Playwright Test for VSCode](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-playwright.playwright) extension. 2. Clone https://github.com/twalshOG/PlaywrightBug 3. Run the test (this project only has one test for simplicity sake) from the Playwright test explorer ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/388515e6-69a1-4c9b-aa92-f266ee14c1ba)
_Note that global setup ran_
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/980e2caf-8b4b-430a-8341-23f3cd46c781) 4. Run the test again via the test explorer ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9a8bfb18-3434-4489-9b2b-b9acbf6c6358)
_Note that global setup did not run_ ### Expected behavior I would expect global setup to run each time I run ### Actual behavior Global setup not running on subsequent runs when tests are run via the Playwright test extension for VS Code. ### Additional context **Work arounds** 1. Close and reopen VS Code 2. Manually trigger "Run global teardown" ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/267d58a2-dde9-4441-866a-8b36b233b6b3)
This makes it so the next run will run global setup, but runs after that will continue to skip global setup. **Thoughts** 1. This look something was intentionally done 1. If I am using my own [test web service](https://playwright.dev/docs/test-webserver) it stays up between runs 2. The SETUP section of the TESTING: PLAYWRIGHT VSCode bar disables Run global setup and enables Run global teardown. 2. Within many contexts this would work great, however it gets really unpleasant when trying to update/debug global setup **Recommendations** 1. Document when global setup/teardown should be/will be executed when using VSCode 2. Add a setting that allows users to decide if they want to use the same global setup between test runs ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3d861307-1b4b-499b-ac2e-296bb7093880) ### Environment ```shell System: OS: macOS 14.5 CPU: (10) arm64 Apple M1 Max Memory: 195.63 MB / 32.00 GB Binaries: Node: 20.12.2 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v20.12.2/bin/node Yarn: 1.22.21 - /opt/homebrew/bin/yarn npm: 10.5.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v20.12.2/bin/npm IDEs: VSCode: 1.92.0 - /opt/homebrew/bin/code Languages: Bash: 3.2.57 - /bin/bash npmPackages: @playwright/test: ^1.46.0 => 1.46.0 Test extension: Playwright Test for VSCode: v1.1.7 ```

issue.title: fix(ui mode): make sure that reload does correctly restart the webserver

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

I can confirm that [`@playwright/test@1.47.0`](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/releases/tag/v1.47.0) no longer has the buggy behavior ðŸŽ‰

issue.title: [Bug]: Playwright ui is not showing any tests

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
### Version

1.47.2

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the terminal in Visual Studio Code.
2. Run the command below:
npx playwright test --ui

### Expected behavior

Tests result should show in the Playwright ui.

### Actual behavior

Playwright ui is not showing any tests.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/909cc847-b3a6-45a4-a6c3-aa5015e32fa8)



### Additional context

_No response_

### Environment

```shell
System:

    OS: Windows 10 enterprise

    Memory: 16GB

  Binaries:

    Node: 20.17.0

    npm: 10.8.3
```
